text:
Hi everyone, can someone explain the error in this code? I want to have multiple output columns as opposed to a tuple:
```transform(df, [:xstart, :xend, :ystart, :yend] => ByRow(magnitude_angle) => AsTable)

ArgumentError: Unrecognized column selector: [:xstart, :xend, :ystart, :yend] => (ByRow{typeof(magnitude_angle)}(magnitude_angle) => AsTable)```

elements.text: Hi everyone, can someone explain the error in this code? I want to have multiple output columns as opposed to a tuple:

transform(df, [:xstart, :xend, :ystart, :yend] => ByRow(magnitude_angle) => AsTable)

ArgumentError: Unrecognized column selector: [:xstart, :xend, :ystart, :yend] => (ByRow{typeof(magnitude_angle)}(magnitude_angle) => AsTable)

text:
The explanation is that most likely you are not using DataFrames.jl 0.22 release as under this release things work as expected:
```julia> magnitude_angle(x...) = x
magnitude_angle (generic function with 1 method)

julia> df = DataFrame(xstart=1:2, xend=11:12, ystart=21:22, yend=31:32)
2×4 DataFrame
 Row │ xstart  xend   ystart  yend
     │ Int64   Int64  Int64   Int64
─────┼──────────────────────────────
   1 │      1     11      21     31
   2 │      2     12      22     32

julia> transform(df, [:xstart, :xend, :ystart, :yend] => ByRow(magnitude_angle) => AsTable)
2×8 DataFrame
 Row │ xstart  xend   ystart  yend   x1     x2     x3     x4
     │ Int64   Int64  Int64   Int64  Int64  Int64  Int64  Int64
─────┼──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   1 │      1     11      21     31      1     11     21     31
   2 │      2     12      22     32      2     12     22     32```

elements.text: The explanation is that most likely you are not using DataFrames.jl 0.22 release as under this release things work as expected:

julia> magnitude_angle(x...) = x
magnitude_angle (generic function with 1 method)

julia> df = DataFrame(xstart=1:2, xend=11:12, ystart=21:22, yend=31:32)
2×4 DataFrame
 Row │ xstart  xend   ystart  yend
     │ Int64   Int64  Int64   Int64
─────┼──────────────────────────────
   1 │      1     11      21     31
   2 │      2     12      22     32

julia> transform(df, [:xstart, :xend, :ystart, :yend] => ByRow(magnitude_angle) => AsTable)
2×8 DataFrame
 Row │ xstart  xend   ystart  yend   x1     x2     x3     x4
     │ Int64   Int64  Int64   Int64  Int64  Int64  Int64  Int64
─────┼──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   1 │      1     11      21     31      1     11     21     31
   2 │      2     12      22     32      2     12     22     32

text: If you are unsure what version you are on please show me the full dump of the error and I will tell you.

elements.text: If you are unsure what version you are on please show me the full dump of the error and I will tell you.

text: Ah, thank you I am using v0.21.8 as you predicted
